Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui.action

Class SearchAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui.AbstractAction
      • com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui.action.SearchAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Action, java.io.Serializable, org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable
    public abstract class SearchAction
extends AbstractAction

    The SearchAction is a specialized action that can be used to execute a search task. Besides the actual search, such a task contains the creation of search proposals during typing. A SearchAction provides methods that will be called when a user types a search query and executes a search.

    Please Note: A SearchAction will be rendered the platform typical way. You don't have to worry about placing a search field and so on.

    Since:
    1.2
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Description copied from class: AbstractAction

        Will be called by the Tabris UI when a user presses the visual representation of this action.

        Specified by:
        execute in class AbstractAction

      • modified

        public abstract void modified​(java.lang.String query,
                              ProposalHandler proposalHandler)

        The modified(String, ProposalHandler) method will be called when a user types into a search field aka. modifies the search query. The ProposalHandler can be used to propose search terms that will be rendered on the accessing client.

        Parameters:
        query - the search query so far.
        proposalHandler - the handler to propose search terms.
        See Also:
        ProposalHandler

      • search

        public abstract void search​(java.lang.String query)

        The search(String) method will be executed when the use executes a search e.g. by hitting enter in a search field.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to search for

      • open

        public final void open()

        Opens the search field on the client.

      • setQuery

        public final void setQuery​(java.lang.String query)

        Sets the query in the client's search field

        Parameters:
        query - the query to display in the client's search field. Must not be null.

      • setMessage

        public final void setMessage​(java.lang.String message)

        Sets the message to display in the client's search field as long as there is not query.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to set into the client's search field. Must not be null.
